Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 01:42PM JPRacket45 wrote: Hi,  I'm so sorry for what you are going through!!  I'm feeling the same way; I've new here and have been madly posting since last week and only one response!!  I wonder if we are so conditioned by the medical field that we are all very unique, and no one wants to post misinformation or say anything to further upset you.  I'm a firm believer that we are all great sources for further information and support and can make up our own minds in the end.  However it is always helpful to get alternative treatment options, other names of doctors/hospitals, strategies for coping, etc.  My prayers are with you!!
Posts.Title: very surprised at how unhelpful this site is amylynn1108 Moderators

Posts.Content: JPRacket45 wrote: Just curious how many of you woman who have breast cancer, had been on HRT for menopausal symptoms and for how long??  Also, if you are already well into menopause, do you still need to take Tamo if you have breast cancer?? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: HRT causing breast cancer JPRacket45 marklee99

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 09:45PM JPRacket45 wrote: Been dealing with clear nipple discharge for 2 yrs, now it has turned bloody but I'm talking about very little dots on my bra in past 2 weeks.  I've had the liquid biopsed twice--negative.  I've had 3 digital mammos which were fine and now they just did an ultrasound and saw something in the duct which looked like a worm like shape to me.  They have referred me to a breast surgeon and said I will most likely need an excisional biopsy to see what is going on.  I feel so angry that they didn't do an ultrasound 2 yrs ago when this all started.  I am feeling very worried.  I also have been on HRT for 9 yrs. and I am 58 yrs. old.  Help??!!
Posts.Title: bloody nipple discharge amybrown MTwoman
